channel.title: Notes on Classroom
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Classroom

item.title: Domain Enumeration Cheat Sheet
item.description:
Get all the member of the Domain Admins Group

Get-NetGroupMember -GroupName "Domain Admins"

or ActiveDirectory module

Get-ADGroupMember -Identity "Domain Admins" -Recursive

Get the group membership for a user

Get-NetGroup -UserName "labuser"

or ActiveDirectory module

Get_ADPrincipalGroupMembership -Identity labuser

Get all computers of the domain

Get-NetComputer (-FullData)

Using ActiveDirectory module

Get-ADComputer -Filter * | select Name Get-ADComputer -Filter * -Properties *

Find all machines on the current domain where the current user has local admin access

Find-LocalAdminAccess -Verbose

item.title: Notes Gnupg
item.description:
How To Use GPG to Encrypt and Sign Messages

Introduction

GPG, or GNU Privacy Guard, is a public key cryptography implementation. This allows for the secure transmission of information between parties and can be used to verify that the origin of a message is genuine.

In this guide, we will discuss how GPG works and how to implement it. We will be using an Ubuntu 16.04 server for this demonstration, but will include instructions for other distributions as well.
